newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stocks drift down in early trade.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks drift down in early trade.

text.p: Wall Street shares edged down in early trade on Thursday, as profit-taking shaved some gains off yesterday's powerful session, which saw the Dow industrials crack the 8,000-point mark for the first time.
The Dow Jones Industrial average paused for breath, dipping around five points to 8034.
The Nasdaq composite, which registered its largest single-point gain on Wednesday, shed five points to 1575.
The long bond rose 5/32 to yield 6.47 percent following a drop in weekly jobless claims and a 4.8 percent gain in housing starts for June.
